properties.name: root
properties.description: returns the root for the scene

properties.name: w
properties.description: returns the width in pixel-sized units of the scene

properties.name: h
properties.description: returns the height in pixel-sized units of the scene

properties.name: animation
properties.description: for animation-related constants

properties.name: stretch
properties.description: for x/y stretch-related constants

properties.name: alignVertical
properties.description: for vertical alignment-related constants

properties.name: alignHorizontal
properties.description: for horizontal alignment-related constants

properties.name: truncation
properties.description: for truncation-related constants

methods.name: create(json)
methods.description:
create a subtree of scene graph Objects 
br / > Use json t: to construct specific object types:
<li > < a href = '#text' > text < /a></li >
<li > < a href = '#textBox' > textBox < /a></li >
<li > < a href = '#wayland' > wayland < /a></li >
<li > < a href = '#image' > image < /a></li >
<li > < a href = '#image9' > image9 < /a></li >
 <li > < a href = '#rectangle' > rect < /a></li >
<li > < a href = '#object' > object < /a></li ><li > < a href = '#scene' > scene < /a></li >
<dt class = 'resource' > create(json) < /dt> <
dd > create resources that can be shared 
<br / > Use json t: to construct specific resource types:
<li > < a href = '#imageResource' > imageResource < /a></li >
<li > < a href = '#fontResource' > fontResource < /a></li >

methods.name: on(string, function)
methods.description:
registers a function callback for the specified event:
  • onMouseDown - parameter object has properties: x, y, flags
  • onMouseUp - parameter object hasproperties: x, y, flags
  • onMouseMove - parameter object has properties: x, y
  • onMouseEnter - parameter object has properties: target, stopPropagation()
  • onMouseLeave - parameter object has properties: target, stopPropagation()
  • onFocus - parameter object has properties: target, stopPropagation()
  • onBlur - parameter object has properties: target, loseFocusChain, stopPropagation() -
      loseFocusChain: true or false to indicate whether the object receiving this onBlur event is within the heirarchy of the object losing focus. Example usage:
  • onKeyDown - parameter object has properties: target, keyCode, flags, stopPropagation()
  • onKeyUp - parameter object has properties: target, keyCode, flags, stopPropagation()
  • onChar - parameter object has properties: target, charCode, stopPropagation()
  • onResize - parameter object has properties w, h
  • onClose - parameter object no properties -
      onClose indicates the object scene is destructed and garbage collected

methods.name: delListener(string, function)
methods.description: unregister a callback function for the specified event

methods.name: getFocus()
methods.description: will return the object that has keyboard focus

properties.name: parent
properties.description: returns this object's parent Object

properties.name: x
properties.description: x-coordinate used as input into the object's transform function in pixel units

properties.name: y
properties.description: y-coordinate used as input into the object's transform function in pixel units

properties.name: w
properties.description: pixel unit width of the object

properties.name: h
properties.description: pixel unit height of the object

properties.name: cx
properties.description: x offset used as the center of rotation and scale

properties.name: cy
properties.description: y offset used as the center of rotation and scale

properties.name: sx
properties.description: scale factor in the x dimension

properties.name: sy
properties.description: scale factor in the y dimension

properties.name: a
properties.description: opacity of the object [0-1]

properties.name: r
properties.description: angle of rotation in degrees

properties.name: id
properties.description: user-assigned associated string identifier for the object. defaults to '.'

properties.name: interactive
properties.description: determines whether the object is mouse interactive. defaults to true.

properties.name: painting
properties.description: when set to false the object and it's children will be snapshotted. when set to true the object and it's children will immediately reflect any changes

properties.name: clip
properties.description: determines whether the drawing done by the object and it's children will be clipped by the objects w and h properties. defaults to false.

properties.name: mask
properties.description: determines whether this object will be used to define an alpha layer mask for the siblings of this object. defaults to false.

properties.name: draw
properties.description: determines whether this object will be drawn

properties.name: focus
properties.description: when set to true, this object will be given keyboard focus. the object that had previous focus will be blurred.

properties.name: numChildren
properties.description: returns the number of immediate child objects that this object parents

properties.name: children
properties.description: returns a collection of child objects for this object

methods.name: getChild(i)
methods.description: returns the i-th child for this object

methods.name: remove
methods.description: removes this object from the scene

methods.name: removeAll
methods.description: removes all children and their descendents from the scene.

methods.name: moveToFront
methods.description: Moves this child to the top of the z-order within its siblings

methods.name: moveToBack
methods.description: Moves this child to the bottom of the z-order within its siblings

methods.name: moveForward
methods.description: Moves this child one forward in the z-order within its siblings

methods.name: moveBackward
methods.description: Moves this child one backward in the z-order within its siblings

methods.name: animateTo(json, duration, tween, type, count)
methods.desciption:
tween the object's properties to the targets specified over the specified duration using the tween function.
  • Tween indicates the interpolator to be used for the animation. See for valid values. Defaults to TWEEN_LINEAR.
  • Type (option) determines whether the animation loops or oscillates. See for valid values. Defaults to OPTION_LOOP.
  • Count is the number of times the animation should repeat. Defaults to 1. Use COUNT_FOREVER to create an animation that won't end until canceled.
    • Returns a promise that will fulfill when the animation is complete.
    animate(json, duration, tween, type, count)
    tween the object's properties to the targets specified over the specified duration using the tween function.
  • Tween indicates the interpolator to be used for the animation. See for valid values. Defaults to TWEEN_LINEAR.
  • Type (option) determines whether the animation loops or oscillates. See for valid values. Defaults to OPTION_LOOP.
  • Count is the number of times the animation should repeat. Defaults to 1. Use COUNT_FOREVER to create an animation that won't end until canceled.
    • Returns an object that can be used to cancel or check on status of the animation.
    registers a function callback for the specified event:
  • onMouseDown - parameter object has properties: x, y, flags
  • onMouseUp - parameter object hasproperties: x, y, flags
  • onMouseMove - parameter object has properties: x, y
  • onMouseEnter
  • onMouseLeave
  • onFocus
  • onBlur
  • onKeyDown - parameter object has properties: target, keyCode, flags
  • onKeyUp - parameter object has properties: target, keyCode, flags
  • onChar - parameter object has properties: target, charCode
  • onSize - parameter object has properties w, h

methods.name: delListener(string, function)
methods.description: unregisters a function callback for the specified event

methods.name: getObjectById(id)
methods.description: returns object with associated id.  search scope is this object and its children.

properties.name: url
properties.description: the url to JavaScript file that defines this scene

properties.name: fillColor
properties.description:
specifies the color to fill the interior of the rectangle. eg. 0xff0000ff, opaque red, Format: 0xrrggbbaa

NOTE: Web style '#rgb' and '#rrggbb' are also supported at 'create()' time, as a convenience shortcut.

properties.name: lineColor
properties.description:
specifies the color to stroke the edge of the rectangle. eg. 0xff0000ff, opaque red, Format: 0xrrggbbaa

NOTE: Web style '#rgb' and '#rrggbb' are also supported at 'create()' time, as a convenience shortcut.

properties.name: lineWidth
properties.description: species the width of the line to stroke around the ege of the rectangle. defaults to 0.

properties.name: url
properties.description: specifies the url of the image to load. supports .png and .jpg

properties.name: stretchX
properties.description: specifies the stretch option to use for the x-coordinate. See stretch constants.

properties.name: stretchY
properties.description: specifies the stretch option to use for the y-coordinate. See stretch constants.

properties.name: ready
properties.description: returns a promise for when the object is ready

properties.name: resource
properties.description:
specifies the to be used by this image
Note that setting url will create an and set the resource property for this image.

Note that w or h equal to -1 will cause the image to be rendered using the imageResource's associated property.

properties.name: url
properties.description: specifies the url of the image to load. supports .png and .jpg

properties.name: insetLeft
properties.description: specifies the first slicing offset on the x-axis

properties.name: insetTop
properties.description: specifies the first slicing offset on the y-axis

properties.name: insetRight
properties.description: specifies the second slicing offset on the x-axis

properties.name: insetBottom
properties.description: specifies the second slicing offset on the y-axis

properties.name: ready
properties.description: returns a promise for when the object is ready

properties.name: resource
properties.description:
specifies the to be used by this image9
Note that setting url will create an and set the resource property for this image9.


Text instance inherits from Object

Text height and width are determined at runtime based on the text value, font, pixelSize, etc.

Spark.description: Text height and width are determined at runtime based on the text value, font, pixelSize, etc.

properties.name: text
properties.description: specifies the text to render

properties.name: textColor
properties.description:
specifies the color to render the text. eg. 0xff0000ff,opaque red,0xrrggbbaa. defaults to opaque black [0x000000ff].

NOTE: Web style '#rgb' and '#rrggbb' are also supported at 'create()' time, as a convenience shortcut.

properties.name: pixelSize
properties.description: specifies the pixelSize of the rendered text

properties.name: fontUrl
properties.description: specifies the url of the face to use.

properties.name: ready
properties.description: returns a promise for when the object is ready

properties.name: font
properties.description:
specifies the to be used by this text
Note that setting url will create a and set the font property for this text.

Spark.description:
TextBox instance inherits from Text

Unlike Text, the height and width of TextBox does NOT change based on the text value; instead, the height and width values in constructor and assignments are respected, and the text is rendered within those dimensions, according to the property values, below.

Behaviors for alignment, wordWrap and clip:
  • If truncation is none and wrap is true, then the text will continue to flow beyond the height of the bounding rectangle, possibly cut off if clip is applied.
  • If truncation is none, and wrap is false, then the line(s) (that /n case has to be taken into consideration) should be centered in the view, even if the text goes beyond its x/width boundaries. If clip is true, text is cut off on either end. Such as:

      alignHorizontal CENTER
        The qu|ick brown fox jumped over the la|zy dog
                    |ick brown fox jumped over the la|

      Or

      alignHorizontal RIGHT
        The quick br|own fox jumped over the lazy dog|
                            |own fox jumped over the lazy dog|

properties.name: wordWrap
properties.description:
when width > 0, and wordWrap is true, wraps text at width of text box. defaults to false.
xStartPos
x position relative to the text box object, in pixels, for the first line of text only, similar to an indent. defaults to 0.
NOTE: xStartPos and xStopPos are only applied when horizontalAlign=LEFT.
xStopPos
x position where text must stop flowing on the last line of text only. If ellipses are applied, the ellipses must also stop at this location. defaults to 0.
NOTE: xStartPos and xStopPos are only applied when horizontalAlign=LEFT.
NOTE: xStopPos can only be applied when truncation is true.

properties.name: ellipsis
properties.description: indicates if ellipsis shall be shown when truncation occurs. Ignored if truncation=NONE. defaults to false.

properties.name: truncation
properties.description: see truncation constants. defaults to NONE.

properties.name: alignHorizontal
properties.description: see horizontal alignment constants. defaults to LEFT.

properties.name: alignVertical
properties.description: see vertical alignment constants. defaults to TOP.

properties.name: leading
properties.description:
number of pixels of height to apply between lines of text when multiple lines of text exist. May be negative. defaults to 0.

Methods

measureText
returns an object with the following properties (measurements are relative to (x,y) of the TextBox object's parent):
  • bounds - object - {x1:0, y1:0, x2:0, y2:0} - The two points representing the bounding rectangle of the complete text
  • charFirst - {x:0, y:0} - The x position represents the left most rendered pixel of the first character on the first line of text. The y position represents the baseline.
  • charLast - {x:0, y:0} - The x position represents the right most rendered pixel of the last character on the last line of text. The y position represents the baseline.

Spark.description: Creates an element which contains a Wayland display.  Any Wayland clients that connect to this display will appear in this element.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the Wayland display.  If no value is assigned a unique name will be generated

properties.name: cmd
properties.description: Specifies a command to launch a Wayland client app to connect to the display.  Consists of the client name optionally followed by arguments

properties.name: server
properties.description: Specifies the name of an rtRemote server

properties.name: clientPID
properties.description: Gives the process pid of the connected Wayland client

properties.name: fillColor
properties.description: specifies the color to fill the interior of the element. eg. 0xff0000ff, opaque red, 0xrrggbbaa.  This will provide background for the connected Wayland client

properties.name: hasApi
properties.description: indicates if the element exports an API.

properties.name: api
properties.description: If hasApi is true, then this is the element's exported API

properties.name: remoteReady
properties.description: returns a promise for when the remote object is ready

methods.name: suspend(bool)
methods.description: Causes the element to cease drawing

methods.name: resume(bool)
methods.description: Causes the element to resume drawing

properties.name: url
properties.description: specifies the url of the JavaScript to use for the child scene

Spark.description: Note: Once Resource is created, the url and proxy are readonly.

properties.name: url
properties.description: url to the resource to be loaded

properties.name: proxy
properties.description: http proxy url to be used while downloading

properties.name: ready
properties.description: returns a promise when the resource is loaded (Read only)

properties.name: loadStatus
properties.description: array of status values (Read only)

properties.name: w
properties.description: pixel unit width of the image

properties.name: h
properties.description: pixel unit height of the image

methods.name: getFontMetrics(pixelSize)
methods.description:
Returns information about the font based on pixelSize. See section 3.a in http://www.freetype.org/freetype2/docs/tutorial/step2.html. The returned object has the following properties:
  • height - float - the distance between baselines
  • ascent - float - the distance from the baseline to the font ascender (note that this is a hint, not a solid rule)
  • descent - float - the distance from the baseline to the font descender (note that this is a hint, not a solid rule)
  • naturalLeading - float - the distance that must be placed between two lines of text (See linegap in section 2 in http://www.freetype.org/freetype2/docs/glyphs/glyphs-3.html#section-1)
  • baseline - float - the baseline position for a line of text

methods.name: measureText(pixelSize, textToMeasure)
methods.description:
Returns an object from which height and width of the measured text can be obtained. Note that this measurement does not consider truncation, word wrapping or alignment that could be used in a TextBox containing this text.
  • h - float - the height of the text
  • w - float - the width of the text

Spark.description: The Animate object is returned from the animate() method. It can be used to check on the status of an animation, as well as to cancel the animation.

properties.name: done
properties.description: Promise that indicates completion of the animation

properties.name: type
properties.description: the type (option) of the animation, e.g. whether the animation loops or oscillates. See for valid values. (Read only)

properties.name: interp
properties.description: Indicates the interpolator used for this animation. See for valid values. (Read only)

properties.name: status
properties.description: status of the animation. See for valid values. Note that this is the constant name returned as a string rather than as its numeric value. (Read only)

properties.name: provduration
properties.description:
duration value used when the animate function was called (Read only)
                    <dt class='number'> provcount </dt>
                    <dd>count value used when the animate function was called. Could be positive numeric value or a constant. See for valid constant values. (Read only)/dd>

properties.name: cancelled
properties.description: reflects whether or not the animation has been canceled. (Read only)

properties.name: props
properties.description: object whose properties are the properties that are being animated, and those property values are the target values for the animation

properties.name: details
properties.description: object whose properties are the properties that are being animated, and those property values are an object reflecting the current state of the animation for that property.

properties.name: from
properties.description: the start value for the current state of this animation. (Read only)

properties.name: to
properties.description: the end value for the current state of this animation. (Read only)

properties.name: duration
properties.description: the duration value for the current state of this animation. (Read only)

properties.name: count
properties.description: current count number for this animation. (Read only)

properties.name: status
properties.description: current status for this animation. See for valid values. Note that this is the constant name returned as a string rather than as its numeric value. (Read only)

Spark.description: http://www.pxscene.org/examples/px-reference/gallery/dynamics.js demonstrates the different animation interpolators available.

properties.name: Interpolators
properties.description: returns a collection of valid TWEEN_ and EASE_ interpolator constants

properties.name: TWEEN_LINEAR
properties.description: constant for specifying a linear tween. constant value is 0.

properties.name: TWEEN_EXP1
properties.description: constant for specifying a exp1 tween. constant value is 1.

properties.name: TWEEN_EXP2
properties.description: constant for specifying a exp2 tween. constant value is 2.

properties.name: TWEEN_EXP3
properties.description: constant for specifying a exp3 tween. constant value is 3.

properties.name: TWEEN_STOP
properties.description: constant for specifying a stop (easein) tween. constant value is 4.

properties.name: EASE_IN_QUAD
properties.description: constant for specifying a 'inquad' tween. constant value is 5.

properties.name: EASE_IN_CUBIC
properties.description: constant for specifying a 'incubic' tween. constant value is 6.

properties.name: EASE_IN_BACK
properties.description: constant for specifying a 'inback' tween. constant value is 7.

properties.name: EASE_IN_ELASTIC
properties.description: constant for specifying a 'easeinelastic' tween. constant value is 8.

properties.name: EASE_OUT_ELASTIC
properties.description: constant for specifying a 'easeoutelastic' tween. constant value is 9.

properties.name: EASE_OUT_BOUNCE
properties.description: constant for specifying a 'easeoutbounce' tween. constant value is 10.

properties.name: OPTION_OSCILLATE
properties.description: constant for use as the type in the animateTo method. the animation with oscillate back and forth. constant value is 1.

properties.name: OPTION_LOOP
properties.description: constant for use as the type in the animateTo method.  the animation will loop continuously. constant value is 2.

properties.name: OPTION_FASTFORWARD
properties.description: constant for use as an option in the animateTo method.  This value can be OR'd with the OPTION type to indicate that any animations in progress should fastforward to their ending values. constant value is 8.

properties.name: OPTION_REWIND
properties.description: constant for use as the type in the animateTo method. This value can be OR'd with the OPTION type to indicate that any animations in progress should rewind to their beginning values.  constant value is 16.

properties.name: COUNT_FOREVER
properties.description: constant to use as count to indicate the animation should never end. When using this value, the promise for the animation will resolve immediately.  constant value is -1.

properties.name: IDLE
properties.description: constant to indicate that the animation has not yet started. constant value is 0.

properties.name: INPROGRESS
properties.description: constant to indicate that the animation is in progress. constant value is 1.

properties.name: CANCELLED
properties.description: constant to indicate that the animation has been cancelled. constant value is 2.

properties.name: ENDED
properties.description: constant to indicate that the animation has ended. constant value is 3.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: constant for use in image stretch options. constant value is 0.

properties.name: STRETCH
properties.description: constant for use in image stretch options. constant value is 1.

properties.name: REPEAT
properties.description: constant for use in image stretch options. constant value is 2.

properties.name: TOP
properties.description: begin text at the upper-most y-coordinate of the textBox. constant value is 0.

properties.name: CENTER
properties.description: center text vertically within the textBox. constant value is 1.

properties.name: BOTTOM
properties.description: justify text to the bottom of the textBox. constant value is 2.

properties.name: LEFT
properties.description: left-justify text in the textBox. constant value is 0.

properties.name: CENTER
properties.description: center text horizontally in the textBox. constant value is 1.

properties.name: RIGHT
properties.description: right-justify text in the textBox. constant value is 2.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: text is not truncated. constant value is 0.

properties.name: TRUNCATE
properties.description: text is truncated at the bottom of the textBox. The last word may be partially truncated. constant value is 1.

properties.name: TRUNCATE_AT_WORD
properties.description: text is truncated at the bottom of the textBox. Truncation occurs at the word boundary. constant value is 2.
